page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The farmland within the area is divided into two broad areas; { 1)The water meadows along the river {Avon.}This area is devoted entirely to pasture. Cattle, both dairy and beef are reared. Many{horses}are also stabled on this land for owners who live in Coventry. Most of the pasture is unimproved grassland. { 2)The higher, dryer land that is {highly cultivated arable land.}Crops include; cereals, oil seed rape, potatoes and fodder crops. About two thirds of the farmland is arable. The land is intensively worked at the Brandon Lane Fruit Farm, this is well situated close to Coventry, on dryer south facing land. Farmers in the north of the area complain of the nuisance from "Townies" who wander over the land, leave litter and annoy animals.
